cpaplugin.cpa.cpas.octagon
Class OctTransferRelation

java.lang.Object
  cpaplugin.cpa.cpas.octagon.OctTransferRelation
All Implemented Interfaces:
TransferRelation
public class OctTransferRelation
extends java.lang.Object
implements TransferRelation

Handles transfer relation for Octagon abstract domain library. See Octagon abstract domain library

Author:
Erkan

getAbstractDomain

public AbstractDomain getAbstractDomain()
Specified by:
getAbstractDomain in interface TransferRelation
Returns:
abstract domain associated with the transfer relation, may be useful if bottom or top elements is accessed by an operation triggered on transfer relation

getAbstractSuccessor

public AbstractElement getAbstractSuccessor(AbstractElement element,
                                            CFAEdge cfaEdge)
Description copied from interface: TransferRelation
Transfers the state to the next abstract state. For example if the analysis in on node 3 and it will proceed to node 4, there is an edge from node 3 to 4. Element is the abstract element on node 3 and it is copied as the element on node 4. The copied element will be updated by processing the edge.

Specified by:
getAbstractSuccessor in interface TransferRelation
Parameters:
element - abstract element on current state
cfaEdge - the edge from one location of CFA to the other
Returns:
updated abstract element

getAllAbstractSuccessors

public java.util.List<AbstractElement> getAllAbstractSuccessors(AbstractElement element)
                                                         throws CPAException
Description copied from interface: TransferRelation
Gets all successors of the current element. This method returns a non-null list only if the abstract element contains traversal information such as a CFA or CFG

Specified by:
getAllAbstractSuccessors in interface TransferRelation
Parameters:
element - abstract element on current state
Returns:
list of all successors of the current state
Throws:
CPAException - if the element does not contain any traversal information such as nodes and edges on CFA.

                              org.eclipse.cdt.core.dom.ast.IASTExpression expression,
                              CFAEdge cfaEdge,
                              boolean truthValue)
                       throws OctagonTransferException
Handles the interpretation of the assumption expression and delegate it to other methods

Parameters:
octElement - element to be modified
expression - statement expression
cfaEdge - statement edge
truthValue - does it follow the path where assumption is true or the path where it is false
Throws:

propagateBooleanExpression

private void propagateBooleanExpression(OctElement octElement,
                                        int opType,
                                        int leftVariableId,
                                        int rightVariableId,
                                        boolean isLeftVarPos,
                                        boolean isRightVarPos,
                                        double valueOfLiteral)
                                 throws OctagonTransferException
Process assumptions even further for final delegation note that we assume that if a > b, then a >= b+1 since we increment the value by 1. So, we assume that all conditions are comparing integer values. Some examples of conversions by this method a > b is converted to a - b >= 1 a > 8 is converted to a >= 7 a >= b is converted to a - b >= 0

Parameters:
octElement - element to be modified
opType - type of conditional operation, e.g. >, ==, != see Operation types
leftVariableId - id of the lefthand side variable of comparison, e.g. if condition is a == b, this is a's id on variable map
rightVariableId - id of the righthand side variable of comparison, e.g. if condition is a == b, this i 's id on variable map, -1 if righthand side variable is a single literal
isLeftVarPos - sign of the left variable, if variable is -a, then false
isRightVarPos - sign of the right variable, if variable is -a, then false
valueOfLiteral - the value of the second variable if it is a literal, e.g. a < 9, alternatively can be used to represent cases such as a < b + 6, then the value will be 6
Throws:
OctagonTransferException
See Also:
VariableMap

handleBooleanExpression

private void handleBooleanExpression(OctElement octElement,
                                     int FirstVariableId,
                                     int SecondVariableId,
                                     boolean isFirstVarPos,
                                     boolean isSecondVarPos,
                                     double valueOfLiteral)
Handles expressions of form +- x +- y <= 2. Final phase of delegation for assumption expressions. The element is updated in this method.

Parameters:
octElement - element to be modified
FirstVariableId - id of the lefthand side variable of comparison, e.g. if condition is a == b, this is a's id on variable map
SecondVariableId - id of the righthand side variable of comparison, e.g. if condition is a == b, this i 's id on variable map, -1 if righthand side variable is a single literal
isFirstVarPos - sign of the left variable, if variable is -a, then false
isSecondVarPos - sign of the right variable, if variable is -a, then false
valueOfLiteral - the value of the second variable if it is a literal, e.g. a < 9, alternatively can be used to represent cases such as a < b + 6, then the value will be 6
See Also:
VariableMap, LibraryAccess

handleNonEquality

private void handleNonEquality(OctElement octElement,
                               int FirstVariableId,
                               int SecondVariableId,
                               boolean isFirstVarPos,
                               boolean isSecondVarPos,
                               double valueOfLiteral)
Handles not equals operation, e.g. a!=b Basically, converts uses the fact that a!= can be interpreted as (a > b) or (b > a), updates the element based on two facts and finally combine them

Parameters:
octElement - element to be modified
FirstVariableId - id of the lefthand side variable of comparison, e.g. if condition is a == b, this is a's id on variable map
SecondVariableId - id of the righthand side variable of comparison, e.g. if condition is a == b, this i 's id on variable map, -1 if righthand side variable is a single literal
isFirstVarPos - sign of the left variable, if variable is -a, then false
isSecondVarPos - sign of the right variable, if variable is -a, then false
valueOfLiteral - the value of the second variable if it is a literal, e.g. a < 9, alternatively can be used to represent cases such as a < b + 6, then the value will be 6
See Also:
VariableMap, LibraryAccess

handleAssignmentOfBinaryExp

private void handleAssignmentOfBinaryExp(OctElement octElement,
                                         org.eclipse.cdt.core.dom.ast.IASTExpression op1,
                                         org.eclipse.cdt.core.dom.ast.IASTExpression op2,
                                         CFAEdge cfaEdge)
                                  throws OctagonTransferException
Handles and delegates assignment of binary expressions of form a = b + c

Parameters:

op1 - left hand side of the assignment as IASTExpression
op2 - left hand side of the assignment as IASTExpression
cfaEdge - unary assignment edge
Throws:
OctagonTransferException

addLiteralToVariable

private void addLiteralToVariable(OctElement octElement,
                                  CFAEdge cfaEdge,
                                  java.lang.String leftOperator,
                                  int variableId,
                                  boolean isVariablePositive,
                                  double valueOfLiteral)
Final method for delegated binary expression assignment of form a = b + 8

Parameters:
octElement - element to be updated
cfaEdge - assignment edge
leftOperator - name of the left hand side variable of the assignment e.g. if operation is a = b + 8, leftOperator is a
variableId - id of the left hand side variable on the right hand side of assignment, see VariableMap e.g. if operation is a = b + 8, leftOperator is b's id.
isVariablePositive - sign of the the left hand side variable on the right hand side of assignment e.g. if operation is a = b + 8, isVariablePositive is the sign of b, positive if true
valueOfLiteral - value of the literal, 8 for a = b + 8

addTwoVariables

private void addTwoVariables(OctElement octElement,
                             CFAEdge cfaEdge,
                             java.lang.String leftOperator,
                             int LvariableId,
                             int RvariableId,
                             boolean isLVariablePositive,
                             boolean isRVariablePositive)
Final method for delegated binary expression assignment of form a = b + c

Parameters:
octElement - element to be updated
cfaEdge - assignment edge
leftOperator - name of the left hand side variable of the assignment e.g. if operation is a = b + c, leftOperator is a
LvariableId - id of the left hand side variable on the right hand side of assignment, see VariableMap e.g. if operation is a = b + c, leftOperator is b's id.
RvariableId - id of the right hand side variable on the right hand side of assignment, see VariableMap e.g. if operation is a = b + c, leftOperator is c's id.
isLVariablePositive - sign of the the left hand side variable on the right hand side of assignment e.g. if operation is a = b + c, isVariablePositive is the sign of b, positive if true
isRVariablePositive - sign of the the left hand side variable on the right hand side of assignment e.g. if operation is a = b + c, isVariablePositive is the sign of c, positive if true

multiplyLiteralWithVariable

private void multiplyLiteralWithVariable(OctElement octElement,
                                         CFAEdge cfaEdge,
                                         java.lang.String leftParam,
                                         int variableId,
                                         boolean isVariablePositive,
                                         double valueOfLiteral)
Final method for delegated binary expression assignment of form a = 2 * b

Parameters:
octElement - element to be updated
cfaEdge - assignment edge
leftParam - name of the left hand side variable of the assignment e.g. if operation is a = 8 * b, leftOperator is a
variableId - id of the left hand side variable on the right hand side of assignment, see VariableMap e.g. if operation is a = 8 * b, leftOperator is b's id.
isVariablePositive - sign of the the left hand side variable on the right hand side of assignment e.g. if operation is a = 8 * b, isVariablePositive is the sign of b, positive if true
valueOfLiteral - value of the literal, 2 for a = 2 * b
